result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L. Fonder Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 465 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.    Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. - Sex Offender Treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
++ Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not have contact with any girls or boys under 18 unless allowed by DOC, SKC or her family   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Register as a Sex Offender.  No cell phones, computers, gaming systems, No access to internet.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.   11 Months STAYED. for purpose of assessment and determining placement by DOC.   Huber (NOT allowed) except for sex offender treatment or assessment.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 6 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail effective this date, 11 months stayed for purpose of assessment and determining placement by DOC; Huber not allowed except for SA treatment or assessment; credit for 465 days served if revoked.  No contact w/any girls or boys under 18 unless allowed by DOC; no contact with SKC or her family.

With ADA McNeill and Atty Edwards the SEH of 8/15/16 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, as DOC Agt Joseph Buchanan requested additional time to complete the report; reset to 9/1/16 at 10am, the DA's office notified the victim of the adjournment.
From DOC Agt Joseph Buchman.
Amended

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Edwards acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 8/15/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states she needs more time to go over the plea form with the deft.  PLEAH set over to 6/30/16 at 3pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Edwards and ADA McNeill the time of the MH on 6/28/16 is changed from 1:30pm to 1pm.
for speedy trial; filed by Atty H Edwards.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Joinder motion set for 6/28/16 at 1:30pm and JS adjourned to 8/8/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
for joinder; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty H Edwards appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Edwards motion to modify bond.  ADA McNeill states she just received information that a new referral is coming against the deft; requests to not entertain a bond motion at this time.  Court holds bond motion in abeyance.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty H Edwards appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but is not brought over.  State in victim compliance.  Atty Edwards motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion to modify bond for reasons set forth on the record.
to modify bond; filed by Atty H Edwards.

With Atty Edwards and by agreement of ADA McNeill the JS of 4/4/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Edwards will have to subpoena another witness from Illinois once she obtains paperwork from ADA McNeill; reset to 6/6/16.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards reports that the State is in the process of obtaining DCFS records from IL.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.
From D.A. regarding additional discovery

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards reports that ADA McNeill is working on getting documents that she had requested at the last hearing.  STC set for 3/17/16 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards motion to adjourn trial, motion for discovery and to modify bond.  Court grants adjournment of trial from 1/11/16 at 8:30am to 4/4/16 at 8:30am; finds that the deft is waiving his speedy trial demand; motion to modify bond is denied for reasons set forth on the record.  STC 2/24/16 at 8:30am to determine if discovery has been received.

ADA McNeill states she does not oppose obtaining records requested in the motion.  Atty Edwards requests to adjourn trial date. Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE. PPPD Det. Laura Hoffman sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Hilary Edwards. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 7-17-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-31-15 @ 8:15am. Atty. Edwards has filed bond motion and argues for modification of bond. State opposes modification. Court reduces bond to $5000 cash with same conditions.
to modify bond; filed by Atty H Edwards.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states they are in agreement w/competency report.  Court finds deft is competent to proceed.  Preliminary hearing set for 6/25/15 at 9:45am.  Bond continued.
Robert Rawski, M.D.
For Competency Exam

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for a preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Edwards raises issue of competency. Court finds probable cause and orders competency evaluation under 971.14 to be performed by the Milwaukee Forensic Unit. Report to be filed in 15 days. Competency hearing on 6-19-15 @ 8:15am. Bond continued.
Atty:  H Edwards.
Filed by Atty h Edwards.
Filed by ADA R Zapf.

130pm

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 6/2/15 @ 845am.  Amended criminal complaint filed.  Atty Perz moves to dismiss 2 paragraph re:mandatory Minimum (Ct 1).  That paragraph is stricken by court.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
